level.text: Senior citizen groups shall be eligible for a license to conduct bingo games, raffles and Monte Carlo night parties if they are comprised entirely of members who are sixty (60) years of age or older, or fifty-five (55) years of age or older if handicapped, and have at least ten (10) members.
Senior citizen groups applying for a Class A, a Class B, or a Class C bingo license according to §§1204.1 and 1204.8 shall be exempt from §§1200.2(c) and (d).
Senior citizen groups applying for a recreational Class D bingo license according to §1204.1(d) shall be exempt from § 1200.2 and all provisions of §1205, and §§1405.1, 1405.9, and 1405.10.
Senior citizen groups applying for a Monte Carlo night party license according to §§1204.20 shall be exempt from §§1200.2(c) and (d).
